abstracts.cdata!:
The Power Distribution Project of
            Guatemala was signed on June 7, 1988 and declared effective
            on September 28, 1989. Upon Empresa Electrica de Guatemala,
            S.A.(EEGSA's), the Borrower's, and the
            Guarantor's request, the portion of the loan that was
            to be re-lent to EEGSA was canceled effective November 16,
            1990, while the portion assigned to Instituto Nacional de
            Electrificacion  (INDE) was canceled effective December 1,
            1993.The primary reason for canceling EEGSA's portion
            was the claim that, in view of the impossibility to disburse
            funds from the loan, they had financed with their own
            resources all the works that had initially been included in
            the project. The lessons learned from this project were: The
            main risks identified in the staff appraisal report (SAR)
            were EEGSA's inexperience with Bank loans and
            procedures and INDE's lack of experience in the
            construction of an energy control center. In retrospect,
            this experience highlights the need to ensure sufficient
            political support for a proposed operation.
